action.text: Rica Rosario Valencia marked as Closed

full_threads.body:
Your typeform Intake Questionnaire has a new response:
  • First up, let us know your name please : )
    James Shute - Movement Rehabilitation

  • Awesome, hi James Shute - Movement Rehabilitation! Now, can you please tell me about your business, what do you do?
    exercise physiologist, treatment of musculskeletal and osteapenial and osteaperosis.
    Thomas, MS, falls and geriatrics.

    trying to change the declining trends of health.
    Specific focus on lifestyle on the inner west community.

    Better version of themselves
    Community, helping locals.

    Eg: free program for 6 locals of 1 month of free sessions upto once a week for the ageing population, using sydney uni students to "make it work".

    students are also a big part of who they work with, allow the students to have specific clients allocated.

    Client journey is primary focus, start to finish, from
    initial consult,
    Sessions
    Re-assess down the track
    (4-12 weeks)
    re-program

    adjust delivery of program from someone looking to increase mobility through to olympic level athletes.

    Athletes aren't the primary focus although James has experience national and international preparation of athletes, world cup winning touch football team for 2019 - specific focus was the strength & conditioning.
    James competed himself.

  • Who is the main audience we're talking to?
    Location Inner west, happy for people to determine their location.


    Predominantly female, 45years onwards.
    Business owners, high performers, semi retired or retired.
    University educated, middle to high income earners, military.
    PA to CEOs.

    "they need someone to direct them to exercise and need to have some kind of investment/financial accountability along with time blocked out in diary"
    "they wont disregard work to do an activity, but if they are financially committed and it is in their calendar they will run with it"

    "how do we get these people to refer their contacts"

    GP, local physios, all specialists and specialists surgeons.
    Primary referral stream for insurance clients is through above networks.

  • Who are your main competitors?
    No real direct competitors, James finds there is more of a team approach to help the individual, GP, specialists, physios etc....
    "the more members you have in the team the most chance for success"

  • And what makes you stand out from your competitors?
    when our clients succeed, it feels like we have achieved out goals. if they don't, we haven't hit our goals.

    We pride ourselves our family approach, we are invested in the success of our clients and will share the failures.

    James trains, rehabs, lives and breathes the active approach, enjoying what he does and how he does it.

  • What might you say could stop people from using you?
    people say its too expensive, these are the people who would not find value.

    Venue can be a turn-off, renting space of a pre-existing business.
    eg: current gym doors are always locked, when a client arrives they are made to wait, James does have clients that comments.
    Covid safety is ultimate re-frame.

  • And what is your proposition to help overcome this?
    tracking visitors, contact tracing and being covid safe.

  • What's the trigger for somebody needing to buy your services/product?
    Medical instructions, referral.

    Not able to physically achieve goals.

    (Gets a lot of golfers)

    Use Korkis as an example.
    Accomplished business owner, now has a family, can afford to back off from work and focus on his own physical strength to continue in life.

    Someone who has experience a PT and has outgrown, and their needs demand more than a "cereal box" PT.

  • Have you seen any designs or brands that you particularly like?
    not attached to his current logo but isn't attached to it.

    Likes the colour, simplicity and the implied movement.

    Loves apple, clean, scientific, futuristic, still has warmth and comfort of something recognizable.

    Hate: Tapout, the MMA, aggression and rough around edges.

    Overall images is warm, family, inviting, smooth, clean, futuristic, functional

  • What keywords come to mind when describing your brand?
    Functional, progressive, consistent, growing,
    (gets a lot of people that are going through tough times).
    Resilience and conditioning.

    Bringing back joy, interaction, integration,
